summary:
• Afghanistan War Commission launches an investigation into America's longest-running conflict.
• The commission aims to uncover the reasons behind the prolonged conflict in Afghanistan.
• The inquiry is expected to reveal insights into the country's future strategy and decision-making processes.

• Bangladesh imposes curfew due to ongoing protests.
• Curfew is implemented after violent clashes result in dozens of deaths.
• The government aims to maintain order during the unrest.

• A German medic has been sentenced to death by Belarusian authorities.
• The sentence was handed down despite calls from human rights groups for clemency.
• The verdict has sparked international outrage over the country's human rights record.

• Canned cocktails in Canada face stiff competition.
• Wildfires in Canada threaten to spread smoke plumes across US borders.
• Canadians debate whether to allow sales of pre-packaged drinks with alcohol.

• Legendary Chinese actress Cheng Pei-pei has passed away at the age of 78.
• She was best known for her iconic role as Jade Fox in the award-winning film "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon".
• Her passing marks the end of an era for Chinese cinema, leaving behind a legacy that continues to inspire generations of filmmakers.

• The Olympics' legacy continues to shape Paris.
• Memories of past Games remain strong in the city.
• The Olympics' impact on Paris is still felt today.

• Gelsenkirchen hosts an unexpected stop on Taylor Swift's European tour.
• This marks one of her lesser-known performances in Germany.
• Fans in Gelsenkirchen eagerly anticipate her visit.

• A tragic boat accident resulted in at least 40 Haitian migrant deaths.
• The incident highlights concerns about safety and regulation in Haitian migration.
• Authorities are investigating the cause of the fire and responding to the aftermath.

• A second fire broke out in Coolock, injuring police officers during the incident.
• Authorities made a significant haul of guns and ammunition in Louth.
• The seizures in Louth were substantial, with multiple firearms recovered.

• Israeli man killed in drone attack on Tel Aviv
• Israel says Gaza war winding down despite rise in deadly civilian strikes
• Israeli right-wing minister visits Temple Mount, showcasing influence

• The bodies of several climbers have been retrieved from the "death zone" on Mount Everest.
• This area is notorious for its extreme weather conditions, making recovery operations challenging.
• The successful retrieval brings closure to families and friends of the deceased climbers.

• Life-threatening heat indexes in the Persian Gulf reach above 140 degrees.
• Extreme weather conditions pose significant risks to human health and safety.
• Heatwaves have severe consequences on ecosystems and wildlife habitats.

• South Africa opens its parliament peacefully, marking a new era.
• An African cyclist makes history with consecutive Tour de France victories.
• Both events showcase progress in their respective fields.

• Devastating warfare is forcing people to make desperate choices in Sudan.
• The country is facing severe challenges due to ongoing conflict.
• This has led to difficult decisions being made by those affected.

• Hotel room 502 had cyanide-tainted teacups.
• Guests died from poisoning; authorities investigate.
• Bangkok hotel staff found dead with unknown cause.

• A Dubai princess has publicly stated her intention to divorce on social media.
• This move goes against traditional customs in the region where divorce is often kept private.
• The princess's statement may pave the way for other women in similar situations to speak out about their personal lives.

• The UK Prime Minister is seeking to improve relations with European countries
• This comes after years of disagreements between the UK and its European counterparts
• The goal is to strengthen ties and work together on common issues

• Global IT services slowly recover after an IT bug caused widespread disruptions.
• President Biden reaffirms his commitment to running despite growing pressure to step aside.
• A judge sets a new trial date for disgraced film producer Harvey Weinstein.
• The Trump-Vance ticket aligns with Europe's far-right political ideology.
• As tensions rise in Aspen regarding Ukraine and Trump, anxiety grows among attendees.
• In other news, research sheds light on why people blush during social interactions.

• A tense election in Venezuela sparks concerns about a potential new wave of Venezuelan emigration to the US.
• The upcoming election has raised fears among international observers that it could lead to another mass migration of Venezuelans fleeing political instability.
• The uncertainty surrounding the outcome of the vote is likely to exacerbate an already dire humanitarian crisis in the country.

• Vietnamese leader Nguyen Phu Trong has passed away at the age of 80.
• His passing marks a significant shift in leadership for Vietnam.
• The impact on the country remains uncertain as it navigates this change.

• Yemen's Houthis claim responsibility for a drone strike
• The attack occurred near a US Embassy branch in Tel Aviv
• This incident highlights escalating tensions between Yemen's warring factions
